moves.2. Nc3: Black generally does pretty well here, particularly with d5.
moves.2... c5 3. Bc4: e6 is a popular response for black.
moves.3... Nc6 4. a3 Ne5 5. Ba2 g5 6. Nf3: Nxf3 could save the undefended pawn.
moves.6... Nc6 7. Nxg5: Pawn e6 staves off N queen/rook fork.
moves.8. Nxf7 Qa5 9. Nxh8 Bg7 10. Ng6 d6 11. N: Nd4 counter threats a nice fork.
moves.15. Ne6 Rd7 16. Nxg7 Rxg7 17. O-O Qd8 18: Whoa!  RxPg2+ trades white's pawn and queen for the black rook.  Do it!
moves.21... Nf8: Nope.  Black makes up five points trading the rook.
moves.22. Bh6 Nd7 23. Bg5 Re6: Ahead eight white has incentive to trade.
